Class HTMLTagClass

HTMLTagClass
Direct Known Subclasses:
AREAtag, Atag, BODYtag, BRtag, Btag, BUTTONtag, CENTERtag, COLGROUPtag, DDtag, DELtag, DIVtag, DLtag, DOCTYPEtag, DTtag, FIELDSETtag, FONTtag, FORMtag, H1tag, H2tag, H3tag, H4tag, H5tag, H6tag, HEADtag, HRtag, HTMLtag, IMGtag, INPUTtag, INStag, Itag, LABELtag, LINKtag, LItag, MAPtag, METAtag, NOBRtag, NOSCRIPTtag, OLtag, OPTIONtag, PREtag, Ptag, Qtag, SCRIPTtag, SELECTtag, SPACERtag, SPANtag, STRONGtag, STYLEtag, SUBtag, SUPtag, TABLEtag, TDtag, TEXTAREAtag, THtag, TITLEtag, TRtag, ULtag, XMLtag, XMPtag
public class HTMLTagClass

Base class for all HTML Tag classes. Tag class renders an html tag, its attributes, the content (if any), and close tag (if needed). Base Class for phpHtmlLib http: *

Since:
PHP 4.0.5
Version:
1.0.1
Author:
Walter A. Boring IV

Default Value: ""

Tag attributes as an array of name value pairs. ie $attributes["cellspacing"]=2;

Default Value: array()

Tag content as a stack ie
content here

$_close_tag_required

private unknown $_close_tag_required
flag to render close tag or not. set to FALSE if no close tag is needed ie

$_content_required

private unknown $_content_required
Flag to render content or not. set to FALSE to not render content. ie

$newline_after_opentag

private unknown $newline_after_opentag
Flag to place a newline after open tag. some tags are nice to have a \n after to make reading of html easier. ie

$newline_after_closetag

private unknown $newline_after_closetag
Flag to place a newline after close tag. usefull for maintaining nice output inside a table

$_always_upper_case

private unknown $_always_upper_case
Flag to tell the renderer to NEVER to render the tag name in lower case no matter what

$_no_finish_slash_xhtml

private unknown $_no_finish_slash_xhtml
Flag to tell the renderer not to place the /> if we are in xhtml compliant mode.

Default Value: FALSE

$_indent_level

private unknown $_indent_level
The indent level for open tag. used for pretty formatting of output ie
<\td>

$indent_flag

private unknown $indent_flag
Flag for pretty (indented) output

$_indent_str

private unknown $_indent_str
String to use as indent string. can be any char. defaulted to 1 space

$_supported_attributes

private unknown $_supported_attributes
list of generally accepted attributes for a tag. Child class should override this. to provide the list. This is only used for informational purposes to help w/ browser compatibility.

$_xhtml_compliant

private unknown $_xhtml_compliant
Flag to let us know to render XHTML 1.0 compliant output. defaulted to FALSE

$_depricated

private unknown $_depricated
Flag to denote that this tag is depricated by the HTML standard.

Default Value: FALSE

$_debug_link_attributes

private unknown $_debug_link_attributes
the list of tag attributes that we should create a clickable link for when in debug mode.

$_xhtml_strict_attributes

private unknown $_xhtml_strict_attributes
The list of attributes not to render if HTML_RENDER_TYPE is "XHTML STRICT"

Default Value: array()

$_htmlentities_attributes

private unknown $_htmlentities_attributes
The list of attributes that we want to run htmlentities() on if we are in XHTML_STRICT mode. Otherwise the validator complains about html characters such as &.
Constructor Detail

HTMLTagClass

public HTMLTagClass(var $attributes,
                    var $content,
                    var $newline_after_opentag)
Class Constructor
Parameters:
array - $attributes Associative array of name="value" pairs of tag atributes. ie array("border"=>"0", "class"=>"hover");
mixed - $content - 1 entry of content to be automatically added to the tag.
boolean - $newline_after_opentag - set this to TRUE or FALSE to alter the default setting for a tag. This will default to -1, which will keep the defined tag default setting.
$attributes - Default Value: NULL
$content - Default Value: NULL
$newline_after_opentag - Default Value: -1

_render_tag_debug

public unknown _render_tag_debug(var $indent_level)
This renders that open tag in debug mode. We do this as a seperate function, so we can override this by the child tag, so it can add a link on content or one of the attributes.

_render_content

public unknown _render_content(var $indent_level,
                               var $output_debug)

int - $indent_level the indentation level for this tag.
$output_debug - Default Value: 0

string

_render_content_debug

public unknown _render_content_debug(var $indent_level)

_build_attribute_string

public unknown _build_attribute_string(var $name,
                                       var $value,
                                       var $debug)
this builds an attribute for a tag. It also filters out any attributes that shouldn't be rendered if they are in the $this->_xhtml_strict_attributes array and HTML_RENDER_TYPE = XHTML STRICT
Parameters:
string - - $name attribute name
mixed - - $value attribute value
$debug - Default Value: 0
Returns:
the tag attribute name=value pair. to be added to the tag.

push

public unknown push()
push content onto content stack adds content to tag as a FIFO. You can have n number of parameters. each one will get added in succession to the content.
Parameters:
mixed - $content - either string, or tag object.

push_reference

public unknown push_reference(var $content)
push content onto content stack adds content to tag as a FIFO You can only add 1 element at a time, and it will be added as a reference. So you can't do push_reference("something");, since "something" is a static.
Parameters:
mixed - $content - either string, or tag object. the tag object gets stored as a reference to the original, so you can push it, then modify it later.
$content - is passed by reference

reset_content

public unknown reset_content()
destroy existing content and start with new content.
Parameters:
mixed - $content can be tag object, or raw (string).

count_content

public unknown count_content()
counts the number of content objects
Returns:
int

Parameters:
